Job DescriptionL'administrateur systèmes et réseaux administre et exploite les moyens informatiques de Safran en Tunisie. Il doit assurer le bon fonctionnement technique du système informatique. Il a pour mission principale de mettre en place des systèmes d'exploitation, des réseaux et des logiciels de base puis d'en assurer la maintenance et l'optimisation. Complementary DescriptionFormer et sensibiliser les utilisateurs aux réseaux et à la sécurité. Assurer la bonne gestion des droits d'accès, pour les machines d'une part, et pour les utilisateurs d'autre part, dans le respect des règles de sécurité de SAFRAN en Tunisie.Apporter son aide aux utilisateurs sur un problème lié au réseau.Prévenir les anomalies et les pannes de fonctionnement du réseau.Assurer l'ensemble des sauvegardes nécessaires pour maintenir la sécurité des données circulant dans le réseau de SAFRAN en Tunisie.Installer et optimiser le fonctionnement des systèmes, réseaux et bases de données.Prendre en compte les exigences des utilisateurs en termes d'exigence de performances du réseau (puissance, rapidité, stabilité).Gérer la volumétrie des données.Gérer, maintenir le parc matériel et logiciel et optimiser son utilisation.Installer, mettre à jour et paramétrer les systèmes d'exploitation et les logiciels de l'environnement utilisateur (bureautique, service, réseaux).Mettre en place des tableaux de bord de suivi des performances et de qualité du réseau (pannes, flux, disponibilité des ressources, sécurité, etc.).Assurer une veille technologique afin d'anticiper les évolutions nécessaires à l'optimisation du réseau.S'assurer de la bonne tenue de l'inventaire du parc informatique.Job RequirementsPolyvalent, curieux Rigoureux et méthodiqueAptitude d'écoute et de dialogue Gestion du stress

Job Title: Logo Auditor  Report to: Quality Supervisor  Location:  Tunis   Overview of Role: We are currently looking for a Logo Auditor to ensure that all external and internal requirements are met before our product reaches our customers.  You will be responsible for inspecting procedures and outputs, identifying mistakes or non-compliance issues.As a Logo Auditor you will have a highly analytical mind with strong focus on attention to details.  What you will do:  Understanding QA standards and methodologies to ensure adherence throughout the production process. Performing routine inspections and quality checks to identify any deviations from quality standards.  Ensuring Artwork meets customer’s requirements and Graphic details are clear of any discrepancies.   Accurately recording errors and tracking them through our data management systems. Investigating reports of product quality issues and collaborating with relevant stakeholders to address them. Reporting issues to line managers or supervisors promptly for swift resolution. Ensuring that the company’s quality assurance standards are consistently met. Preparing and presenting comprehensive reports, dashboards, and charts summarizing QA activities. Providing valuable recommendations and suggestions for continuous improvement in QA processes. Addressing and discussing quality assurance matters and proposed solutions with Supervisors. Creating training materials, standard operating procedures (SOP’s), and guidelines to uphold quality standards. Working towards achieving departmental objectives and goals.   Requirements and Skills:  Fluent in English, and proficiency in other European languages is an advantage. Capable of working under pressure and managing multiple tasks efficiently to meet tight deadlines. Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, for effective interaction with stakeholders. A keen eye for details and Visual Communication Skills Prior experience in Quality Control or Inspection role is preferred. Experience with Quality Assurance Techniques e.g.: Lean six sigma is an advantage. Team player with excellent organizational skills and the ability to prioritize tasks effectively. Proficient in MS Office tools for documentation and reporting purposes. Graphic Design Skills is an advantage.   About National PenIn business for over 50 years, National Pen is a world class provider of personalized marketing solutions. We offer high value/low-cost branded marketing products to small and medium businesses through multiple channels, with low minimum order quantities and high levels of customer care. National Pen operates across 10 locations globally with facilities in Europe, North America, Africa, and Asia and employee over 3500 people through our multi-channel business. In December 2016 National Pen Corporation was acquired by Cimpress N.V., a leader in mass customisation. Cimpress employs 10,000 people across 30 countries globally and offers a portfolio of more than 20 successful brands including Vistaprint, National Pen, Albelli, Drukwerkdeal, Pixaprinting, Exprint and WIRmachenDruck.  #LI-Onsite #LI-MT1

iObeya, c’est une aventure qui grandit depuis plus de 10 ans.Notre secret : un esprit startup, 150 personnes passionnées qui donnent le meilleur d’elles-mêmes dans un environnement de travail épanouissant, construit sur de fortes valeurs humaines et une ambition commune stimulante.  Rejoindre iObeya, c’est participer à un projet d’entreprise en très forte croissance en France et à l’International. C’est travailler dans un cadre dynamique et une structure participative où chacun s’investit dans le développement de la vie de l'entreprise. En 10 ans, les solutions de Digital Visual Management d’iObeya ont déjà séduit plus de 400 grandes entreprises toutes industries confondues, dans plus de 30 pays et 500 000 utilisateurs quotidiens. Basées sur les pratiques Lean et Agile, iObeya révolutionne la gestion de la performance dans tous les départements de l’entreprise en donnant aux dirigeants, managers et opérateurs, le cockpit visuel temps réel. Aujourd’hui, notre objectif est de devenir le leader international du Management Visuel Digital.Pour accompagner notre ambition portée par une forte croissance, nous recherchons notre QA Lead pour s’engager dans l’aventure iObeya.Tes principales Missions/Responsabilités:Exécuter et optimiser les processus de test afin d’assurer la meilleure qualité du produit;Examiner et analyser les spécifications du produit;Créer des plans de test et des cas de test détaillés, complets et bien structurés;Estimer, prioriser, planifier et coordonner des activités de test;S’assurer que les bugs sont correctement identifiés, documentés, suivis et résolus;Aider dans le ”troubleshooting” des problèmes de qualité;Ce poste est pour toi si:Doté(e) d’une formation en Informatique Bac+5;Justifiant de 6 ans d’expérience en assurance qualitéUne maîtrise des méthodes d’assurance qualité Logiciels, ses processus et ses outils;Une maîtrise d’au moins un outil de tests API;Une expérience en formalisation de test avec le langage Gherkin serait un plus;Connaissances en base de données (Oracle,MySql…);Un fort esprit d’analyse et de synthèse;Vous aimez travailler en équipe, dans un contexte agile et challenging;Une maîtrise parfaite du français (écrit/oral) ainsi qu’une maîtrise professionnelle de l’anglais;Poste à pourvoir immédiatement dans les bureaux de iObeya à Tunis aux Berges du Lac.

An energetic, self-starter who excels in interpersonal skills, with a focus on listening and questioning skills Customer Care experience is required  Have eagerness to learn new things Open-minded and capable to adapt to all company’s directions and processes. Self-motivated and goal oriented The desire to be successful exceed targets and integrate into a team-based organization Advanced MS office (Excel / Power Point /Word)  Excellent communication skills Be a good team player Strong stakeholder management experience  Knowledge of one additional European Language: French, German, Dutch, Spanish, Italian, is an advantage. Fluent in English    #LI-Onsite #LI-MT1

About the job Data Scientist / OCR specialist
Job overview:
Location: Fully remote, EU timezone (CET +/- 2hours)Start date: ASAPLanguages: French is mandatoryExperience: Minimum 5 yearsOur client: Saas building an MVP with OCR technology
Job Summary:
The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing OCR solutions to extract text and data from images and documents. This role requires expertise in OCR technologies and a strong programming background.
Job Responsibilities:
Development of OCR Algorithms:Design and implement OCR algorithms to accurately extract text and data from various sources like images and scanned documents.Optimize algorithms for speed, accuracy, and reliability.Integration with Applications:Integrate OCR solutions with existing applications and systems to automate data extraction processes.Collaborate with software developers to ensure seamless integration of OCR functionalities.Selection of OCR Tools:Evaluate and choose appropriate OCR tools and libraries based on project requirements.Stay updated on the latest OCR technologies and tools in the industry.Training and Testing:Train OCR models using machine learning techniques to enhance recognition accuracy.Conduct thorough testing and validation of OCR solutions to ensure high precision and recall rates.Customization and Configuration:Customize OCR solutions to meet specific project requirements and handle various document formats.Configure OCR parameters for optimal performance in different scenarios.Performance Optimization:Optimize OCR solutions for performance, scalability, and resource efficiency.Implement parallel processing and other techniques to improve processing speed.Documentation:Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for OCR algorithms, configurations, and integration procedures.Provide documentation for troubleshooting and support purposes.
Qualifications:
Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.Proven experience in developing OCR solutions, including algorithm design and integration.Strong programming skills in languages like Python, Java, or C++.Knowledge of OCR libraries and frameworks such as Tesseract, ABBYY, Google Cloud Vision API.Understanding of machine learning concepts related to OCR is a plus.Familiarity with image processing techniques and formats.Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.Strong communication and collaboration skills.

See yourself being part of a large, transformational change? We’ve got offices in some of the most inspiring places worldwide – and we’re still growing. Your career here really could take you anywhere…About Us:At Iress, we believe technology should help people perform better every day. Since our beginning in 1993, people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. From the world’s most established financial brands to new and disruptive players, we help improve every aspect of our clients’ businesses so that they can work better, every day. Iress is one of Australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 2,300 people across Australia, United Kingdom, Africa, Canada, France, New Zealand and Asia.Quanthouse, part of Iress , is the global independent provider of high performance API-based market data, AI and Algo trading solutions. Quanthouse helps hedge funds, market makers, investment banks, brokers and trading venues achieve optimal trading performance, develop and integrate new trading strategies, comply with regulatory requirements, test existing and new trading infrastructure tools and rationalise operating costs. Quanthouse provides high performance API-based end-to-end systematic trading solutionsAbout the role:Iress is looking for a skilled, driven Senior network engineer to hit the ground running and be part of our agile global network team. This position will have focussed initial responsibilities with support from fellow engineers towards the delivery of a strategic Juniper network rollout with these responsibilities widening over time.About You:Core Skills, Knowledge and Attributes:Excellent understanding of Juniper network architecture using EX and QFX series switchesExcellent understanding and troubleshooting capabilities using Cisco (Catalyst, Nexus, ASA and ASR series) and Arista (7050, 7150 and 7260 series) within complex market data (multicast and unicast), latency sensitive environments. Excellent understanding of Arista spine and leaf network architecture using eVPN VXLAN technology.10+ years’ experience specializing in designing/supporting large scale LAN/WAN environments and supporting/diagnosing IP based network issues.Tertiary qualifications or equivalent CCNP/Juniper Equivalent certifications or higher. CCIE written or Juniper equivalent qualifications are highly advantageous. Excellent understanding of all networking technologies – Ethernet, spanning tree, routing protocols (BGP and OSPF), TCP, UDP, FTP/SFTP firewall, WAN technologies and complex market data (multicast and unicast) environments.Ability to work autonomously.Ability to work proactively and collaboratively with various technical teams within Iress.Take ownership of problems and coordinate to resolution (end-to-end).Proven ability to diagnose and resolve complex network issues.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both oral and written, including the ability to communicate with non-technical customers and colleagues.Ability to work under pressure. Have a “can do” attitude and drive to develop solutions that move Iress forward. Experience with AWS technologies will be advantageous. Previous experience working with firewalls ( Cisco ASA ,Fortigate and Juniper SRX), CoS/QoS, network management tools, network sniffers and VPN Technologies will be advantageous.Some of our non statutory benefits include:Private medical, disability & life insuranceHybrid work environment with flexible hoursGenerous leave benefits which include 22 days annual leave and 8 paid days per year to extend your weekends (The Long Weekend)Access to various learning and development programsWork for a global company with access to global opportunities.Iress has long supported flexibility in the way people work and have invested heavily in tools and processes to support this. We also believe in the power of teams and the magic that happens when we work together in the right way.Employment TypeEmployeeTime TypeFull time

job_title: Director of People and Culture - Four Seasons Hotel Tunis
job_description: Director of People and Culture - Four Seasons Hotel Tunis page is loaded Director of People and Culture - Four Seasons Hotel TunislocationsTunis time typeFull time posted onPosted 30+ Days Ago job requisition idREQ10314006 About Four Seasons:Four Seasons is powered by our people. We are a collective of individuals who crave to become better, to push ourselves to new heights and to treat each other as we wish to be treated in return. Our team members around the world create amazing experiences for our guests, residents, and partners through a commitment to luxury with genuine heart. We know that the best way to enable our people to deliver these exceptional guest experiences is through a world-class employee experience and company culture. At Four Seasons, we believe in recognizing a familiar face, welcoming a new one and treating everyone we meet the way we would want to be treated ourselves. Whether you work with us, stay with us, live with us or discover with us, we believe our purpose is to create impressions that will stay with you for a lifetime. It comes from our belief that life is richer when we truly connect to the people and the world around us.About the location:Beachfront relaxation on north Africa’s Mediterranean coast. In the heart of Tunisia’s vibrant and exotic capital city, our modern Mediterranean oasis offers a calm, laid-back beachfront escape alongside this bustling business hub. Relax at our Spa and pools, stay connected with state-of-the-art business services, or take a step back in time – more than 3,000 years of ancient civilization are at your fingertips.The Role of Director of People and Culture: We currently have an opportunity for an experienced Director of People and Culture to join our Four Seasons Hotel Tunis team! This role reports to our General Manager with a dotted line to the Regional Director of People and Culture and will be responsible for leading the People, Culture, and Learning strategy and execution for Four Seasons Hotel Tunis; providing People, Culture, and Learning support with the overall goal being that the hotel is perceived as the Employer of Choice in your destination. You will be the Cultural Advocate of the Golden Rule in every employee action in your hotel and responsibilities will include championing top talent and actively supporting succession planning, supporting the hotel as a Business Partner, fostering relationships with others as a coach, supporting and driving Corporate People and Culture initiatives, actively supporting recruitment, selection, onboarding and development requirements, evaluating the effectiveness of People and Culture programs and initiatives and analyzing compensation and benefits trends to ensure a balance between cost and employee experience. You will also be responsible for developing the learning quality and experience on property; delivering workplace learning and development, performance improvement programs, and initiatives to best achieve long-term business success. Our Ideal Director of People and Culture candidate will have:Passion for people, talent management, and learning, and will be a Business Partner; strategic, strong business acumen, understanding of operational needs, and the ability to contribute to key strategies and operational decisions for the hotel, a catalyst for change and an employee champion. Fluency in English, French, and Arabic is a must for this location, along with current eligibility to work in Tunisia.Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts can offer what many hospitality professionals dream of; the opportunity to build a life-long career with global potential and a real sense of pride in work well done. We look for talent who share the Golden Rule – people who, by nature, believe in treating others as we would have them treat us. As Four Seasons works towards phenomenal growth in the next decade, our most valuable partners continue to be our talent, with whom we have a strong relationship based on the Golden Rule. This relationship is made tangible by the awards received year after year by Four Seasons on a corporate level, as well as by our hotels, resorts, and residences around the world, making us an undisputed “employer of choice.”Dedicated to perfecting the travel experience through continual innovation and the highest standards of hospitality, Four Seasons can offer what many hospitality professionals dream of -the opportunity to build a life-long career with global potential and a real sense of pride in work well done.

About the job Summer Internship 2024
Vneuron Risk & Compliance is a leader and a key player in Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and in Combating Terrorist Financing (CTF). We empower 100+ worldwide financial institutions to achieve full AML compliance in 45+ countries in Europe, Africa, USA, and the Middle East.
The estimated amount of money laundered globally in one year is between 2 to 5% of global GDP, equivalent to $800 billion - $2 trillion US dollars. This huge amount of illicit funds is coming from corruption, drug dealing, child labor, organ trade, and so forth.
Our purpose is to fight financial crime through technology in order to ensure global business growth, international security and help change the world for the better. About Software suite Reis RCS
This year, Vneuron is recognized among top 50 most innovative RegTech companies globally and most recently, we have been awarded The best risk calculation engine for regulatory compliance at the RegTech Insight Awards Europe 2024.
Earlier, our solution Reis RCS was ranked among the best point solutions in Trade-Based Anti-Money Laundering worldwide in the Chartis Research Quadrant 2022. Furthermore, we received the prestigious Best AML Compliance Solution award at the Waters Rankings 2023, a renowned technology magazine based in the UK, USA, and Hong Kong.
Our Culture & Values
Vneuron puts the development of its team at the heart of its priorities. We provide a pleasant and comfortable work environment. Our organization is collaborative and flat-structured. And, our management is available and present.
Moreover, We have a passionate and committed young team who values respect and sharing spirit. You will be surrounded by highly skilled experts willing to guide you to evolve in all aspects of your career. We aim to spread our innovative technology worldwide, so we can take part in generating a positive impact.
We believe that every person is unique and special. Thus, we provide attentive and active listening to your ideas and propositions as we believe that you will have an essential role in achieving our next milestone. Why you would love to join us?
Challenging context to expand your technical and professional skillsOpportunity to start a promising careerPleasant and comfortable work environment (Relaxation and play areas)Work along with our passionate and brilliant Spark teamHighly qualified mentor to guide you through the realization of your projectBeing surrounded by Highly skilled experts in different fields such as Software Architecture, Software Release Management, Software Quality Assurance, Project Management, Consulting, Selling, etc.Equal opportunity no matter your gender, religion, culture, color, etc. ﻿What are we looking for?
Software engineering students with an outstanding thirst for learning, and determined to evolve and succeedSomeone who's driven by his strong valuesRich academic experience with learning activitiesSolid bases in OOP, SQL, data structure, and algorithms. ﻿What do we propose?
We offer multiple projects in different disciplines :
Software development (Spring boot, Hibernate, Angular, PostgreSQL, etc)Quality Assurance & Test AutomationDevSecOps / SRE (Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Terraform, Jenkins, GitLab, etc)Network Security and System AdministrationBusiness Analysis Your Next Step
If you have the ambition to stimulate your career path with new challenges while capitalizing on your potential, Apply Now !
Follow us on LinkedIn to know more about the Spark team and our Spark solutions.
We would be very happy to meet you and give you much more information!

Yassir is the leading super App in the Maghreb region set to changing the way daily services are provided. It currently operates in 45 cities across Algeria, Morocco and Tunisia with recent expansions into France, Canada and Sub-Saharan Africa. It is backed (~$200M in funding) by VCs from Silicon Valley, Europe and other parts of the world. We offer on-demand services such as ride-hailing and last-mile delivery. Building on this infrastructure, we are now introducing financial services to help our users pay, save and borrow digitally. Helping usher the continent into a digital economy era. Job Overview: 
The Country Head of Operations ensures the smooth and effective execution of learning sessions at Hackerspaces throughout the country. The role involves coordinating with various stakeholders to improve the learning experience, manage instructors' performance, and oversee the logistical aspects of session execution. Responsibilities:

Student Experience

Oversee the management of student issues across all Hackerspaces, ensuring that all student concerns are addressed promptly and effectively
Initiate and lead projects aimed at improving the overall student experience at Hackerspaces.
Monitor and support strategies to ensure high course completion rates across the country, identifying and addressing systemic barriers to student success.


Instructors Hiring:

Ensure that all Hackerspaces hire the best possible instructors on time for all sessions, maintaining a high standard of teaching and learning
Ensure adherence to hiring and onboarding processes, reporting any deviations to the General Manager and Central Operations


Community building:

Facilitate and support the organization and growth of local communities around each Hackerspace, enhancing student engagement and satisfaction
Organize and manage both internal and external events to foster community engagement and promote learning opportunities


Strategic Oversignt:

Lead the response to any operational emergencies at Hackerspaces, coordinating with local managers to resolve issues swiftly.
Oversee operations across all Hackerspaces within the country, ensuring alignment with the organization's mission and operational standards.



Qualifications: 
5+ years working in Operations department or Logistics
Demonstrated ability to lead and manage teams 
Strong problem-solving, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
Very clear oral and written communication
Strong Experience working with Tech Systems (ERP - CRM or equivalent)
 Hiring Process:

Step 1: Initial interview to filter on previous experience (Ops + Management) + culture Fit (GM) 45’
Step 2: Candidates will be given 1 week to prepare a business case relevant to the role, demonstrating their strategic planning and problem-solving capabilities.
Step 3: 60-minute interview with a panel including the General Manager and Leadership from the Central Team.

45 minutes to discuss the business case, focusing on solutions and approaches presented by the candidate.
15 minutes to explore challenges the candidate has faced in similar roles and their approaches to overcoming them.

job_title: Expert en science de données / intelligence artificielle appliquée
job_description: TEHORA est présentement à la recherche d’un(e) expert en science de données / intelligence artificielle appliquée ayant d’excellentes aptitudes techniques, d’excellentes connaissances et qui souhaite mettre à profit ses compétences au sein d’une équipe polyvalente.Sans être exhaustifs, voici les services et livrables que devra fournir la personne retenue.Description des travaux ou des biens livrables :Appliquer des outils d'apprentissage automatique et des techniques statistiques pour développer des modèles d'apprentissage machine et prendre en charge la gestion des modèles tout au long du cycle de vie du modèle;Développer, surveiller et améliorer les algorithmes prédictifs d’Espace Données en collaboration avec les équipes de développement ML et chargé de produit;Créer des algorithmes et concevoir des expériences pour fusionner, gérer, interroger et extraire des données afin de fournir des rapports personnalisés aux collègues, aux clients ou à l'ensemble de l'organisation;Améliorer les procédures de collecte de données pour inclure des informations pertinentes pour la construction des solutions d’intelligence artificielle; Tester des modèles d'exploration de données pour sélectionner les plus appropriés pour le développement des algorithmes prédictifs; Maintenir une communication claire et cohérente, à la fois verbale et écrite, pour comprendre les besoins en données et rendre compte des résultats; Combiner des modèles grâce à la modélisation d'ensemble; Présenter des informations à l'aide de techniques de visualisation de données; Évaluer l'efficacité des sources de données et des techniques de collecte de données et améliorer les méthodes de collecte de données; Fournir de la documentation technique et opérationnelle de la plateforme MLOps (Wiki, spécifications de conception et de cartographie); Participer à l'examen du code par les pairs, aux tests et à la mise en œuvre des meilleures pratiques de développement logiciel; Participer aux projets de développement en assurant un suivi rigoureux des tâches et le respect des échéances, et ce, en collaborant avec de multiples parties prenantes dans un environnement itératif, rapide et en constante évolution; Participer à l’évolution de l’architecture des solutions d’intelligence artificielle d’Espace Données ou de toute autre solution ayant recours à l’intelligence artificielle; Conseiller sur les bonnes pratiques en développement et en assurance qualité en participant à l’amélioration continue des standards de développement et en s’assurant de leur respect lors des revues de code.

Acronis is a world leader in cyber protection—empowering people by providing them with cutting-edge technology that enables them to monitor, control, and protect the data that their businesses and lives depend on. We are looking for a Priority Support Engineer who is ready to join our mission in creating a #CyberFit future!As a Priority Support Engineer, you will function as the main support technical expert in specific Company’s products or services. Your responsibility will be to resolve the customers’ technical incidents using your own expertise and extensive cooperation with the Company’s Engineering departments, as well as craft solutions, submit bug reports, coordinate complex tasks with other teams (Engineering, QA, DCO, Product Management), communicate with the customers to their complete satisfaction.  Every member of our “A-Team” has an instrumental role and impact on the success of Acronis’ innovative and growing business, so we are looking for someone who enjoys working in dynamic, global teams and thrives in a fast-paced and rapidly changing work environment. Just like everyone at Acronis, the ideal candidate will embody all of our company values: responsive, alert, detail-oriented, makes decisions, and never gives up. WHAT YOU'LL DO Work on resolving various technical incidents for the Company’s customers involving various software, networking and hardware environments Responsible for building and maintaining strong relationships with customers able to thrive in the ever-changing work environment Stay abreast of the latest changes, trends and technological advancements in the industry (Cloud, Storage, Virtualization, Business Applications, etc.). Maintain deep knowledge of Company operations to support client requests effectively Interact with various departments to analyze and resolve problems Provide technical advice to junior staff members and review technical results, evaluations and analyses. Provide for the development of junior staff within the work group through mentoring and technical guidance Develop documentation regarding installation, upgrades, support, and compatibility issues WHAT YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS) Fluent French and English (both oral and written, Upper Intermediate as a minimum)Network troubleshooting experience (Wireshark, tcpdump, iperf) and proficiency in deploying and configuring services like DHCP, DNS, L2TP/IPSEC/Open VPN, HTTP servers Windows Server experience (know how to gather and analyze various Windows logs and dumps; application level troubleshooting with Procmon and Process Explorer) Business applications experience (should be familiar with one or more of the following: MS Exchange, MS SQL, MySQL, Oracle DB, Citrix XenApp, NTP servers) Ability to describe the details on technical issues in all their complexity when needed Great communication skills and customer focus, ability to prioritize and switch between a variety of time-sensitive issues Passion for troubleshooting, ability to come up with efficient solutions for unordinary issues Would be considered plus if you have 2+ years of work experience in an applicable industry and role  Linux experience Awareness of Virtualization *Please submit your resume and application in EnglishWHO WE AREAcronis is revolutionizing cyber protection by unifying backup, disaster recovery, storage, next-generation anti-malware, and protection management into one solution. Regular - Ingénieur DATA Ingénieur DATAref :ESOF135400-SOFTU03724 | 17 Apr 2024 apply before : 31 Jul 2024 Immeuble Sterling, Rue du lac de Biwa 1053 Les berges du lac - Tunisia  about the roleLes Missions Au sein d’une équipe pluridisciplinaire fonctionnant en train Safe ; vous aurez pour mission principale de développer et de garantir un haut niveau de qualité logicielle des composants développés. Dans ce cadre, vous aurez la charge de différentes activités allant de la conception jusqu’à la mise en production. En tant que data engineer, vous serez amené à recueillir les besoins métier et les transformer en définition de données compréhensibles, en modèles de données et en exigences de qualité pour les données, le tout dans un écosystème DATA-IA.Activités principales• Conception et développement de solutions de traitement des données : Concevoir, développer et mettre en œuvre des pipelines de données efficaces et évolutifs sur la plateforme Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Cela inclut l'extraction, le chargement et la transformation des données (ELT) avec DBT, ainsi que la création de flux de données en temps réel.• Gestion des bases de données : Concevoir et gérer des bases de données adaptées aux besoins spécifiques du projet. Cela peut inclure la modélisation des données, la configuration des bases de données, l'optimisation des performances et la gestion des sauvegardes.• Analyse des données : Utiliser des outils et des techniques d'analyse de données pour extraire des informations exploitables à partir des ensembles de données. Cela peut inclure l'utilisation de langages de requête tels que SQL, ainsi que des outils d'analyse et de visualisation des données.• Sécurité des données : Assurer la sécurité des données en mettant en place des mesures de protection appropriées, telles que le chiffrement des données, la gestion des accès et la conformité aux réglementations en matière de protection des données.• Collaboration avec les équipes : Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes techniques et les parties prenantes pour comprendre les besoins en matière de données, proposer des solutions et assurer la mise en œuvre efficace des projets. about youDe formation ingénieur, vous avez une expérience de 2 ans dans les métiers de gestion et traitement des données à grande échelle skillsCompétences techniques exigées - Maitrise du développement : Gitlab, Pyhton, REST, SQL. - Connaissances avancées dans la conception et le développement de solutions de traitement des données sur la plateforme GCP, en utilisant des outils tels que Google BigQuery, Google Cloud Dataflow, Google Cloud Pub/Sub, etc - Connaissances en Devops. -Appétence aux environnements de travail en Agile (Scrum/SaFe). - La certification Google Cloud Platform serait un plus.Aptitudes relationnelles et comportementales- Capacité à monter en compétences rapidement sur le processus d’intégration et sur les aspects métier d’un écosystème SI complexe - Capacité à travailler de manière autonome et à gérer plusieurs sujets simultanément. - Capacité d’analyse et de synthèse - Prise d’initiative - Compétences relationnelles - Flexibilité et ouverture d’esprit - Esprit d’équipe  contractRegular Hybrid work Only your skills matterRegardless of your age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neuroatypia, disability or appearance, we encourage diversity within our teams because it is a strength for the collective and a vector of innovation. Acronis is a world leader in cyber protection—empowering people by providing them with cutting-edge technology that enables them to monitor, control, and protect the data that their businesses and lives depend on. We are looking for a Cloud Expert Engineer who is ready to join our mission in creating a #CyberFit future!In this role you will be a main technical support expert in specific Company’s products or services. Your responsibility will be to resolve the customers’ technical incidents using your own expertise and extensive cooperation with the Company’s Engineering departments, as well as craft solutions, submit bug reports, coordinate complex tasks with other teams (Engineering, QA, DCO, Product Management), communicate with the customers to their complete satisfaction. Every member of our “A-Team” has an instrumental role and impact on the success of Acronis innovative and growing business, so we are looking for someone who enjoys working in dynamic, global teams and thrives in a fast-paced and rapidly changing work environment. Just like everyone at Acronis, the ideal candidate will embody all of our company values: responsive, alert, detail-oriented, makes decisions, and never gives up. WHAT YOU'LL DO Work on resolving various technical incidents for the Company’s customers involving various software, networking and hardware environments via email, phone and chat. Build and maintain strong relationships with customers able to thrive in the ever-changing work environment. Stay abreast of the latest changes, trends and technological advancements in the industry (Cloud, Storage, Virtualization, Business Applications, etc), while maintain deep knowledge of Company operations to support client requests effectively. Interact with various departments to analyze and resolve problems; Provide technical advice and mentoring to junior staff members and review technical results, evaluations and analyses. Develop documentation regarding installation, upgrades, support, and compatibility issues. Ensure that all relevant communication, documents, and files related to the case are accurately recorded in the support system WHAT YOU BRING Fluent French and English (both oral and written, Upper Intermediate as a minimum)Advanced technical knowledge in areas such as: Windows Server; Network troubleshooting (Wireshark, tcpdump, iperf); deploying and configuring services like DHCP, DNS, L2TP/IPSEC/Open VPN, HTTP servers Working knowledge of Linux/UNIX (application and configuration management; RHCSA as a baseline; CLI power user) Experience with Virtualization (know how to deploy and manage Virtual Machines on VMware ESXi / Microsoft Hyper-V clusters) Proficiency in Business applications (should be familiar with one or more of the following: MS Exchange, MS SQL, MySQL, Oracle DB, Citrix XenApp, NTP servers) Passion for troubleshooting Strong internal customer focus with desire to learn all aspects of the business High level of discipline, attention to detail, and ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment while still maintaining a high-level of accuracy Outstanding organizational, problem solving, and multi-tasking skills Team-player and positive attitude, eager to do more and help out Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work with minimal supervision *Please submit your resume and application in EnglishWHO WE AREAcronis is revolutionizing cyber protection by unifying backup, disaster recovery, storage, next-generation anti-malware, and protection management into one solution. This all-in-one integration removes the complexity and risks associated with non-integrated solutions and offers easy, complete and reliable data protection for all workloads, applications, and systems across any environment—all at a low and predictable cost.Founded in Singapore in 2003 and incorporated in Switzerland in 2008, Acronis now has more than 2,000 employees and offices in 34 locations worldwide. About Us
We empower people by upskilling and reskilling them on digital skills through Tech-enabled, affordable quality trainings. We provide trainings for the future of work on the most in-demand digital skills. We go fast and break things: So far, we have trained +50,000 students in 10 countries in Middle East and Africa.  What we're looking for We are on the lookout for a Product Manager who is passionate about creating meaningful educational experiences and is skilled in both the discovery and delivery aspects of product management. This role is not just about building features; it's about deeply understanding our business challenges, student needs, and market opportunities to develop solutions that significantly improve learning outcomes and operational efficiency. We are looking for a creative and passionate Product Marketing Associate (PMA) to support the Product team on the release and launch of new features and products. She/he will be responsible for developing marketing strategy for successful launches. A geek in the marketing world or a marketer-soul in the Tech space. 
Responsibilities

Discovery:

Lead user research and data analysis initiatives to uncover insights into student behaviors, needs, and challenges.
Work closely with business teams, designers, and students to identify and prioritize real problems that need solving.
Validate ideas through rapid prototyping, A/B testing, and early feedback loops.


Delivery:

Collaborate with engineering teams to define, design, and deliver solutions that address the identified business and user needs.
Manage the product development lifecycle, ensuring timely releases and high-quality outcomes.
Monitor product adoption and usage, iterating based on user feedback and performance metrics to drive continuous improvement.


Foster a culture of innovation, encouraging the team to think beyond traditional features and focus on impactful solutions.

Qualifications 
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Education, Technology, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years’ experience in product management, preferably in the edtech, online education, or digital learning sectors.
Proven ability to lead both discovery and delivery efforts in product development, demonstrating strong analytical, research, and project management skills.
Experience working directly with engineering teams and familiarity with agile development practices.
Exceptional problem-solving abilities and a track record of delivering solutions that address real business challenges.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, able to work effectively with teams across different functions and levels of the organization.


Experience with user research and usability testing methodologies.

Job Title:  Global Product Data Lead  Report to:    Global Manager of Merchandising & Product Data  Location:  Tunis  Overview of Role:  The role of the Global Product Data Lead is to handle Goldstar’s global needs to organise, maintain, and publish Goldstar product information and content using software including PIM, Oracle, Repoman, ATP, Goldstar Website Admin, and multiple Sourcing Platforms specific to the promotional products industry.  You will lead a team of multiple specialists, coordinators, and assistants, in working with a variety of programs to manage product, pricing, photos, images, and data in support of Goldstar’s product data needs, supporting both existing and new products, whilst maintaining accuracy and attention to detail.  Additionally, there will be projects to improve and develop our product line, and support GS team research and analysis needs with data gathering, spreadsheets, and presentations.  This role will also provide support language translations, management of English, French, German and Italian product data files and day-to-day support for Goldstar team needs.  You and your team will also collaborate with the Pricing, Competitive Analysis, and Compliance teams as needed.Performing the role in line with the Goldstar Values:Family - Treating our customers and our Goldstar team members like familySimplicity - Ensuring all of our solutions we supply for our customers are easy with no hassleDelighting our customers – We make sure every customer enjoys working with us by exceeding their expectations and providing the highest level of customer service and a quality productWork hard, play hard - Work hard and give our all and at the same time love and enjoy what we do  What you will do:  Work with team to assemble detailed product data and process improvements for Goldstar product data globally. Organise and make improvements to the New Product Introduction process globally. Build an expanded team to support increased needs and workload, and improving our level of service, for both EU and NA. Improve processes and gain efficiencies with aligning global workflows. Assure items are activated for GS in Oracle and work with Product Development and PDM teams for any corrections. Track inventories of active SKUs and communicate stock status issues globally. Direct editing and optimisation of new GS website platform & Sourcing Platforms with new/phaseout SKUs, process changes to keep information up to date. Support GS Sales and Customer Care teams by helping answer product questions. Maintain Product Image & Template library, working with NPI team, supervising workflow for Product Photographer and working with Graphic Artists as needed. Maintain Goldstar channel data and images in PIM to support PromoStandards data flows. Work with Samples Dept., Quality Control and Production teams as needed. Manage Product Databases, Masterfiles, Industry Platform data files and customer product databases – provide hands-on management of both customer & sourcing platform data files, ensuring they are up-to-date and uploaded to relevant websites and industry platforms. Sourcing platform optimisation – Undertake research to ensure Goldstar products are optimised on industry sourcing / search platforms globally.  Language translations – employ meticulous attention-to-detail in translating marketing materials from English into other languages, then proof reading and sign-off for printing. Provide analysis for category-level, product-level, and SKU-level sales data. Other duties and projects as required including but not limited to samples service support, industry research, and other support tasks.   What we need from you:Previous Experience and qualifications   A Bachelor’s Degree in is an advantage. 2+ years in a previous product, administrative, marketing or online/data management.  Key Skills and attributes   Languages – Written and oral fluency in English and French languages required (in addition; German or Italian are also desirable) Meticulous attention to detail is one of the most important skills for this role – you will be able to demonstrate how you let nothing slip through the cracks. Knowledge of Cimpress MCP, PIM, and similar systems, is a big advantage Computer literacy and proficiency in standard Microsoft Office applications and Excel in particular. Strong administrative abilities - excellent organisation and time management skills and a capacity to manage multiple projects. Problem solving skills - The ability to think on your feet, the ability to work hard under pressure, and great problem-solving skills are three essential attributes for this role. Asense of urgency and the ability to work in a fast-paced and challenging work environment.  What we will provide:  The opportunity for you to make a meaningful and serious contribution towards a very successful and rapidly growing business. A supportive environment with fantastic opportunities to grow and develop your career. A modern, fast paced, and exciting company culture.   Goldstar:  Goldstar, part of the global National Pen Group, is one of the industry’s fastest growing Trade Suppliers.  With a strong presence in both Europe and North America, Goldstar is becoming famous for offering a strong range of writing instruments, bags, and drinkware, combined with headache-free, all-inclusive pricing and a passionate team who will do whatever it takes to delight their customers.   Goldstar’s mission is to become the best supplier in the industry, providing our distributors with amazing products and unparalleled service#LI-Hybrid   #LI-SK1

About the Role:We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated SuccessFactors Team Lead Consultant to join our team at Müller's Solutions. As a Team Lead Consultant, you will be responsible for leading and overseeing the implementation projects of the SuccessFactors suite for our clients. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams and guide them in delivering successful and high-quality solutions that meet client requirements.Key Responsibilities: Lead and manage SuccessFactors implementation projects, ensuring project milestones are met and deliverables are of high quality. Provide guidance and mentorship to the project team, ensuring their training and development needs are met. Collaborate with clients to understand their business requirements and translate them into effective SuccessFactors solutions. Oversee the configuration, customization, and integration of SuccessFactors modules to align with client requirements. Work closely with project managers, functional consultants, and technical teams to ensure successful project delivery. Provide ongoing support and issue resolution for SuccessFactors implementations. Stay updated with the latest trends and developments in SuccessFactors and share knowledge with the team to drive continuous improvement.

job_description: Titre: Conseiller(e) de service à la clientèle - Langue FrançaiseEmplacement: TunisAperçu du rôle :En tant qu'agent du service clientèle entrant de notre centre de contact, vous serez le premier point de contact de nos clients actuels et potentiels. PRIMAIRES:•Résoudre les requêtes et les problèmes des clients, négocier, de manière opportune par téléphone ou par e-mail.•Fournir des solutions appropriées et des alternatives dans les délais prévus Report to:   Global Product Data Lead  Location:  Tunis  Overview of Role:  The role of the Product Data Specialist will be to organise, maintain, and publish Goldstar product information and content using software including PIM, Oracle, Repoman, ATP, MCP, Goldstar Website Admin, and multiple Sourcing Platforms specific to the promotional products industry.  You will work with a variety of web-based programs to manage product data, pricing, images, and documents, in support of Goldstar’s product merchandising needs, supporting both existing and new products, while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail.  Additionally, there will be projects to support GS customer data needs with data gathering, spreadsheets, presentations, etc.   Responsibilities include management of product data files, language translations, and day-to-day support for Goldstar team needs.Performing the role in line with the Goldstar Values:Family - Treating our customers and our Goldstar team members like familySimplicity - Ensuring all of our solutions we supply for our customers are easy with no hassleDelighting our customers – We make sure every customer enjoys working with us by exceeding their expectations and providing the highest level of customer service and a quality productWork hard, play hard - Work hard and give our all and at the same time love and enjoy what we do  What you will do:  Work with team to assemble detailed product data and process improvements for merchandising & products. Direct editing of new GS website platform & Sourcing Platforms with new/phaseout SKUs, process changes to keep information up to date. Manage Product Databases, Industry Platform data files and customer product databases – provide hands-on management of both customer & sourcing platform data files, ensuring they are up-to-date and uploaded to relevant websites and industry platforms. Sourcing platform optimisation – Undertake research to ensure Goldstar products are optimised on industry sourcing / search platforms    Language translations – employ meticulous attention-to-detail in translating marketing materials from English into other languages, then proof reading and sign-off for printing  Maintain Product Image & Template library, working with NPI & GS graphic artists as needed  Maintain Goldstar channel data and images in PIM. Work with Samples Dept., Quality Control and Production teams as needed Help maintain a library of GS Compliance documentation Assure items are activated for GS in Oracle and work with NPI team for any corrections Track inventories of active SKUs and communicate stock status issues Other duties and projects as required including but not limited to samples service support, Industry Market research, and other support tasks    What we need from you:Previous Experience and qualifications   A Bachelor’s Degree in is an advantage 2+ years in a previous product, administrative, marketing or online/data management  Key Skills and attributes   Languages – Written and oral fluency in English and French languages required (in addition; German language is strongly preferred) Meticulous attention to detail is one of the most important skills for this role – you will be able to demonstrate how you let nothing slip through the cracks Knowledge of Cimpress MCP, PIM, and similar systems, is a big advantage Computer literacy and proficiency in standard Microsoft Office applications and Excel in particular, database experience is a plus Strong administrative abilities - excellent organisation and time management skills and a capacity to manage multiple projects  Problem solving skills - The ability to think on your feet, the ability to work hard under pressure, and great problem-solving skills are three essential attributes for this role Asense of urgency and the ability to work in a fast-paced and challenging work environment  What we will provide:  The opportunity for you to make a meaningful and serious contribution towards a very successful and rapidly growing business. A supportive environment with fantastic opportunities to grow and develop your career. A modern, fast paced, and exciting company culture.   Goldstar:  Goldstar, part of the global National Pen Group, is one of the industry’s fastest growing Trade Suppliers.  With a strong presence in both Europe and North America, Goldstar is becoming famous for offering a strong range of writing instruments, bags, and drinkware, combined with headache-free, all-inclusive pricing and a passionate team who will do whatever it takes to delight their customers.   Goldstar’s mission is to become the best supplier in the industry, providing our distributors with amazing products and unparalleled service.

About us:
At Cognira, we strongly believe that people are the biggest asset of our company. Our hand-picked team consists of passionate, collaborative, and forward-thinking individuals from all over the globe. We are passionate about making science easy and accessible to retailers, helping them get more value from people, data, and systems. We bring together expertise in retail, science, and scalable technologies to automate and enhance the quality of decision-making through software and consulting services. For the last three years in a row, Cognira has been recognized as one of the fastest-growing companies in North America. We are proud to have a growing team of domain experts and data scientists, as well as a culture that fosters strong and long-lasting relationships with our clients.  Our values: 
Stand up for what’s right
Customers are always first
Think like an Entrepreneur. Act like a CEO.
Learn, Unlearn, Relearn
No brilliant jerks allowed
All work and no play is no fun at all
 Are you ready to grow with us? To find out more about Cognira, please visit our website at www.cognira.com
About this role:
The Customer Support Associate will be responsible for engaging with our customers through the help desk portal to answer and/or route all questions into the organization for timely resolution. This role will also be responsible for supporting customers during regular updates and system changes; triaging and routing issues through the appropriate Tiers of support; and regularly contributing to internal and client knowledge bases. The position will require learning about Cognira’s offerings from a functional perspective and using that knowledge to answer day-by-day usage questions and coordinating with our team of technical experts.  Important: Please submit your resume in English only. What you will do:

Provide first-line response to customer questions during working hours
Respond with efficiency and tact; speed and courtesy to start, expertise comes over time
Become an expert in our software offerings and workflows
Participate in support rotations for client issues during business hours
For rare high-severity issues, some communication may be required outside of core business hours; this will be as needed and not a regular off-hours rotation
Coordinate work efforts across internal teams; effectively communicating with the client and escalating as needed to  manage each request to completion
Support clients during scheduled and ad hoc releases of new functionality and system maintenance
Assist with maintaining client-specific resources; assist with maintaining department confluence and training materials

What you bring to the table:

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Empathetic approach to customer support
Excellent follow-up and meticulous organizational skills
Intrinsically motivated beyond delegated work
Thrive in a collaborative, feedback-driven environment
Ability to problem solve and develop creative solutions
Comfortable with technology-centered, fast-paced environments

Even better if you have:

2 years of customer service or case support experience
Retail experience
Understanding of agile methodology and Atlassian tool suite
High level of proficiency with Jira tools
Experience managing multiple clients with minimal supervision
 Important: Please submit your resume in English only. What we offer:

In addition to joining us on our journey to build state-of-the-art, AI-enabled software, you’ll also get a ton of perks!
Casual dress code, social events, and after-work activities. 
Flexible, diverse work environment. 
Respectful, innovative team.  
You get a competitive salary and a progressive bonus while getting a startup experience at a company with an awesome culture. 
Medical insurance for you & your family (spouse & children)
22 days of PTO in addition to national holidays.
Annual Wellness budget
Laptop & all necessary IT kit for work
Referral Program

Job Number 24042403 Job Category Rooms & Guest Services Operations Location Tunis Marriott Hotel, Centre Urbain Nord, Tunis, Tunisia, Tunisia VIEW ON MAP Schedule Full-Time Located Remotely? N Relocation? N Position Type Non-Management POSITION SUMMARY Process all guest check-ins by confirming reservations, assigning room, and issuing and activating room key. Process all payment types such as room charges, cash, checks, debit, or credit. Process all check-outs including resolving any late and disputed charges. Answer, record, and process all guest calls, messages, requests, questions, or concerns. Coordinate with Housekeeping to track readiness of rooms for check-in. Communicate parking procedures to guests/visitors and dispatch bell staff or valet staff as needed. Supply guests with directions and information regarding property and local areas of interest. Run daily reports (number of arrivals, departures), identify any special requests, and check reports for accuracy. Complete designated cashier and closing reports in the computer system. Cash guests' personal checks and traveler's checks. Count bank at the beginning and end of shift. Balance and drop receipts according to Accounting specifications. Follow all company safety and security policies and procedures; report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager. Follow all company policies and procedures; ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards; anticipate and address guests’ service needs; assist individuals with disabilities; thank guests with genuine appreciation. Speak with others using clear and professional language; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others. Comply with quality assurance expectations and standards. Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent. Related Work Experience: No related work experience. Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience. License or Certification: None Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law. Marriott Hotels strive to elevate the art of hospitality, innovating at every opportunity while keeping the comfort of the oh-so-familiar all around the globe. As a host with Marriott Hotels, you will help keep the promise of “Wonderful Hospitality. Always.” by delivering thoughtful, heartfelt, forward-thinking service that upholds and builds upon this living legacy. With the name that’s synonymous with hospitality the world over, we are proud to welcome you to explore a career with Marriott Hotels. In joining Marriott Hotels, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work, begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global team, and become the best version of you. JW Marriott is part of Marriott International's luxury portfolio and consists of more than 100 beautiful properties in gateway cities and distinctive resort locations around the world. JW believes our associates come first. Because if you’re happy, our guests will be happy. JW Marriott associates are confident, innovative, genuine, intuitive, and carry on the legacy of the brand’s namesake and company founder, J.Willard Marriott. Our hotels offer a work experience unlike any other, where you’ll be part of a community and enjoy true camaraderie with a diverse group of co-workers. JW creates opportunities for training, development, recognition and most importantly, a place where you can pursue your passions in a luxury environment with a focus on holistic well-being. Treating guests exceptionally starts with the way we take care of our associates. That’s The JW Treatment™. In joining JW Marriott, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work, begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global team, and become the best version of you.

job_title: Technical Support Engineer, Priority Team (German Language)
job_description: Acronis is a world leader in cyber protection—empowering people with cutting-edge technology that enables them to monitor, control, and protect the data that their businesses and lives depend on. We are looking for a Technical Support Engineer with German who is ready to join us in creating a #CyberFit future!The Technical Support Engineer with German will function as the main support technical expert in specific Company’s products or services. Be the person responsible for resolving the customers’ technical incidents using your own expertise and extensive cooperation with the Company’s Engineering departments. Craft solutions, submit bug reports, coordinate complex tasks with other teams (Engineering, QA, DCO, Product Management), communicate with the customers to their complete satisfaction.Every member of our “A-Team” has an instrumental role and impact on the success of Acronis’ innovative and growing business, so we are looking for someone who enjoys working in dynamic, global teams and thrives in a fast-paced and rapidly changing work environment. Just like everyone at Acronis, the ideal candidate will embody all of our company values: responsive, alert, detail-oriented, makes decisions, and never gives up.WHAT YOU'LL DOFocus on fast and effective technical issues troubleshooting involving various software, networking and hardware environmentsPerform technical analysis of customer issues and define plan for fixing themDirect involvement with the product and engineering teamsProvide technical advices to junior staff members and review technical results, evaluations and analysesCreate Knowledge Base articles, best practice guides and other documentationWHAT YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS) Fluent German and English (both oral and written, Upper Intermediate as a minimum);Ability to describe the details on technical issues in all their complexity when needed;2 or more years of work experience in an applicable industry and role are a plus;Great communication skills and customer focus, ability to prioritize and switch between a variety of time-sensitive issuesResponsible and quick to decide and act;Network troubleshooting (know how to use Wireshark, tcpdump, iperf; experience with deploying and configuring services like DHCP, DNS, L2TP/IPSEC/Open VPN, HTTP servers);Windows Administrator;Linux Administrator is a plus;Virtualization experience is a plus;Business applications (should be familiar with one or more of the following: MS Exchange, MS SQL, MySQL, Oracle DB, Citrix XenApp, NTP servers);Passion for troubleshooting, ability to come up with efficient solutions for unordinary issues;Good communication skills and customer focus, ability to prioritize and switch between a variety of time-sensitive issues;Passion for troubleshooting, ability to come up with efficient solutions for unordinary issues;Strong internal customer focus with desire to learn all aspects of the business;High level of discipline, attention to detail, and ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment while still maintaining a high-level of accuracy;Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills;Outstanding organizational, problem solving, and multi-tasking skills;Team-player and positive attitude, eager to do more and help out, views challenging situations as opportunities;Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work with minimal supervision;*Please submit your resume and application in EnglishWHO WE AREAcronis is revolutionizing cyber protection by unifying backup, disaster recovery, storage, next-generation anti-malware, and protection management into one solution.  This all-in-one integration removes the complexity and risks associated with non-integrated solutions and offers easy, complete and reliable data protection for all workloads, applications, and systems across any environment—all at a low and predictable cost.Founded in Singapore in 2003 and incorporated in Switzerland in 2008, Acronis now has more than 2,000 employees and offices in 34 locations worldwide. Its solutions are trusted by more than 5.5 million home users and 500,000 companies, and top-tier professional sports teams. Acronis products are available through over 50,000 partners and service providers in over 150 countries and 26 languages.Our corporate culture is focused on making a positive impact on the lives of each employee and the communities in which we live. Mutual trust, respect, personal achievement, individual leadership, and a belief that we can contribute to the world everyday are the cornerstones of the Acronis Team.Acronis is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.#LI-LD1

iObeya, c’est une aventure qui grandit depuis plus de 10 ans.Notre secret : un esprit startup, 150 personnes passionnées qui donnent le meilleur d’elles-mêmes dans un environnement de travail épanouissant, construit sur de fortes valeurs humaines et une ambition commune stimulante.  Rejoindre iObeya, c’est participer à un projet d’entreprise en très forte croissance en France et à l’International. C’est travailler dans un cadre dynamique et une structure participative où chacun s’investit dans le développement de la vie de l'entreprise. En 10 ans, les solutions de Digital Visual Management d’iObeya ont déjà séduit plus de 400 grandes entreprises toutes industries confondues, dans plus de 30 pays et 500 000 utilisateurs quotidiens. Basées sur les pratiques Lean et Agile, iObeya révolutionne la gestion de la performance dans tous les départements de l’entreprise en donnant aux dirigeants, managers et opérateurs, le cockpit visuel temps réel. Aujourd’hui, notre objectif est de devenir le leader international du Management Visuel Digital.Dans le cadre de cette volonté de forte croissance, nous recherchons un Software Engineering - Python motivé-e pour s’engager dans l’aventure iObeya, et pour voir le produit évoluer grâce à lui/elle.Vos principales Missions/Responsabilités : En collaboration avec l’équipe Intégrations, vous développerer des APIs de service autour de notre solution iObeya pour répondre à des besoins clients. Vous participerez à l’analyse du besoin, conception, prototypage, développement et optimisation des APIs jusqu’à leur mise en production  Assurer la qualité des réalisations en respectant les normes de développement, le processus de travail en équipe et de tests;   Proposition de fonctionnalités innovantes  Rédiger des documentations;  Ce poste est pour vous si: Vous avez une expérience confirmée de minimum 1 ans en tant que Software Engineer Maîtrise les conceptes API Restful et de l’architectures micro-services Bonne connaissance des chaînes d’intégration Gitlab et des concepts DevOps Vous êtes rigoureux.se, polyvalent.e et autonome  Vous êtes curieux de l’Intelligence artificelle (IA) dans des usages concrets. Vous êtes force de proposition et assurez une régulière veille technologique Vous accordez une grande importance sur la qualité de votre code et de vos livrables; Vous aimez travailler en équipe, dans un contexte agile et challenging Créer vous passionne; Un profil Github ou toute démonstration d'un projet personnel serait un plus. Poste en CDIPoste à pourvoir immédiatement dans les bureaux de iObeya à Tunis aux berges du Lac avec un rythme de télétravail hybride.

Regular - Business Analyst Business Analystref :ESOF132746-SOFTU03569 | 29 Jan 2024 apply before : 31 Mar 2024 Immeuble Sterling, Rue du lac de Biwa 1053 Les berges du lac - Tunisia  about the roleMissions Dans le cadre de la mise en œuvre du plan stratégique Groupe « Lead the future » et la recommandation « Open Source First », l’Open Source étant un levier de l’innovation ouverte et de la souveraineté numérique, vous intégrerez l’équipe Open Source Groupe. Vous aurez comme mission l’analyse des besoins clients afin de trouver les solutions Open Source les plus adaptées à leurs attentes et les mettre en œuvre via des Proof Of Concepts. About the job Juriste spécialisé en NTIC
Vneuron Risk & Compliance occupe une position de premier plan en tant qu'acteur clé dans la lutte contre le blanchiment de capitaux (LBC) et le financement du terrorisme (FT). Notre mission principale consiste à développer des technologies dédiées à la prévention des crimes financiers, contribuant ainsi à la croissance mondiale et à la sécurité internationale.
En effet, selon les données statistiques fournies par l'UNODC (Office des Nations unies contre la drogue et le crime), le blanchiment d'argent à l'échelle mondiale représente entre 2% et 5% de notre produit intérieur brut international, soit une fourchette estimée à 800 milliards à 2 billions de dollars américains. Cette somme considérable de fonds illicites provient de diverses sources telles que la corruption, le trafic de drogue, l'exploitation des enfants au travail, le commerce d'organes, et bien d'autres activités criminelles.
Reconnu par des experts en matière de LBC - FT, Vneuron R&C est positionnée dans la liste Deloitte Regtech Universe et notre solution Reis RCS fait partie du top 100 des solutions Regtech les plus innovantes pour l'année 2022.
Plus récemment, nous avons reçu le prestigieux Best AML Compliance Solution au Waters Rankings 2023, un prestigieux magazine technologique basé au Royaume-Uni, aux États-Unis et à Hong Kong.
Reis RCS assure l'automatisation des processus de conformité contre le blanchiment d'argent (Anti-Money Laundering, AML). Sur une base quotidienne, Reis RCS assure le filtrage d'environ 27 millions de profils et est utilisé par plus de 15 000 agents à travers le monde.
Plus d'une centaine d'Institutions Financières mondiales ont bénéficié de Reis pour se conformer pleinement à la réglementation LBC-FT à travers 45 pays en Europe, en Afrique, aux Etats Unis et au Moyen Orient. Notre Culture
Vneuron met au cœur de ses priorités l'épanouissement de ses collaborateurs et permet à ses équipes de travailler dans des conditions optimales.
Nous vous invitons à intégrer une équipe jeune, passionnée et animée par le goût du challenge.
Nous portons également les valeurs du respect, de l'engagement et de l'évolution.
Nous croyons que chaque personne est unique et spéciale. Ainsi, nous assurons une écoute attentive et active de vos idées et propositions car nous croyons que vous aurez un rôle essentiel dans la réalisation de notre prochaine étape.
Vous serez aussi entourés par des experts techniques et fonctionnels pour vous aider à évoluer dans votre parcours professionnel.
Afin de renforcer notre présence dans le monde, nous recherchons un juriste spécialiste en NTIC (nouvelles technologies de l'information et de la communication). Missions :
Conseiller les équipes opérationnelles sur des problématiques juridiques liées aux activités de la société.Rédiger, réviser tous types contrats liés à l'activité de la société et d'une manière générale tous documents juridiques.Assurer le suivi des contrats jusqu'à finalisation et signature (signatures des deux parties, coordination d'envoi des contrats au client, récupération des originaux signés et classement interne). Suivre les questions de droit des sociétés et suivre l'application des règles de bonne gouvernance interne et diffusion des bonnes pratiques.Participer à la préparation de la bibliothèque juridique interne et assurer sa mise à jour.Gérer les dossiers contentieux (instruire les dossiers et suivre les procédures juridiques).Gérer les interactions et les formalités avec et auprès des autorités locales concernant les sujets juridiques. Profil :
Titulaire d'une licence / maîtrise idéalement en droit des affaires, vous disposez d'une expérience similaire de 1 à 2 ans (une première expérience professionnelle dans une société informatique est souhaitable.Vous avez de bonnes connaissances en gouvernance.Vous êtes autonome, organisé(e), polyvalent(e), réactif (ve) et rigoureux(se).Vous avez une approche opérationnelle des problématiques juridiques.Vous avez un grand sens de l'éthique.Vous maîtrisez le français et avez de bonnes connaissances en anglais professionnel. Avantages :
L'opportunité de travailler sur des projets intéressants et qui participent à rendre le monde meilleurUn contexte évolutif et internationalUne équipe jeune, passionnée, à grand potentiel et qui valorise l'esprit de partageUn environnement agréable et convivialUne évaluation équitable de votre candidature quel que soient le genre, la nationalité, la religion, l'origine et la couleur du candidat. Prochaine étape
Vous avez de l'audace et la volonté de réussir ? N'attendez plus, venez contribuer à votre succès et au nôtre !
Suivez-nous sur LinkedIn afin d'en savoir plus sur notre Spark team et nos solutions.

About the job English Speaker Lead Generation Specialist
Vneuron Risk & Compliance is a leader and a key player in Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and in Combating Terrorist Financing (CTF). We empower 100+ worldwide financial institutions to achieve full AML compliance in 45+ countries in Europe, Africa, USA, and the Middle East.
The estimated amount of money laundered globally in one year is between 2 to 5% of global GDP, equivalent to $800 billion - $2 trillion US dollars. This huge amount of illicit funds is coming from corruption, drug dealing, child labor, organ trade, and so forth.
Our purpose is to fight financial crime through technology in order to ensure global business growth, international security and help change the world for the better. About Software suite Reis RCS
This year, Vneuron is recognized among top 50 most innovative RegTech companies globally and most recently, we have been awarded The best risk calculation engine for regulatory compliance at the RegTech Insight Awards Europe 2024.
Earlier, our solution Reis RCS was ranked among the best point solutions in Trade-Based Anti-Money Laundering worldwide in the Chartis Research Quadrant 2022. Furthermore, we received the prestigious Best AML Compliance Solution award at the Waters Rankings 2023, a renowned technology magazine based in the UK, USA, and Hong Kong.
Our Culture & Values
Vneuron puts the development of its team at the heart of its priorities. We provide a pleasant and comfortable work environment. Our organization is collaborative and flat-structured. And, our management is available and present.
Moreover, We have a passionate and committed young team who values respect and sharing spirit. You will be surrounded by highly skilled experts willing to guide you to evolve in all aspects of your career. We aim to spread our innovative technology worldwide, so we can take part in generating a positive impact.
We believe that every person is unique and special. Thus, we provide attentive and active listening to your ideas and propositions as we believe that you will have an essential role in achieving our next milestone.
In order to strengthen our presence worldwide, we are looking for a Lead Generation Specialist based in Tunisia. Missions / What you will do
Data Cleaning and Maintenance:
Regularly review and clean CRM data to ensure accuracy and completeness.Identify and rectify any inconsistencies or errors within the database
    Lead Sourcing:
Utilize various sources to identify and gather potential leads for different sectors and regions.Implement effective strategies to maximize lead generation efforts.
    Data Enrichment:
Enhance CRM data by gathering additional information relevant to leads, including industry trends, company news, and contact details.
    Qualification:
﻿﻿Evaluate lead quality and relevance to ensure alignment with our target audience.﻿Implement lead scoring methods to prioritize high-potential leads.     Collaboration: Work closely with the sales and marketing teams to align lead generation efforts with overall business objectives.Provide regular updates on lead generation metrics and performance.     Required profile
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skillsSelf-starter and creativeExcellent written English level is a mustGreat interest and desire to evolve in the sales fieldSales process understanding is an asset Benefits
﻿The opportunity to work in exciting contexts and to help generate a positive impact around the worldCareer Growth opportunityHealthcare and wellness Benefits to you and your familyAn evolving and pleasant environment that challenges you to develop new skillsAppropriate conditions to help you focus on what you love doingA winning team that has relied on Respect, Sharing, and Passion for what it doesEqual Employment Opportunities: gender, religious, culture equity
